verses.verse: “Son of man, set your face against (Gen. 36:8; Deut. 2:5; Jer. 25:21; 49:7-22; Ezek. 25:12-14; Joel 3:19; Amos 1:11, 12; Obad. 1-9, 15, 16) Mount Seir and (Amos 1:11) prophesy against it,
and say to it, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Behold, O Mount Seir, I am against you; (Ezek. 6:14) I will stretch out My hand against you, And make you most desolate;
I shall lay your cities waste, And you shall be desolate. Then you shall know that I am the LORD.

(Ezek. 25:12) “Because you have had an ancient hatred, and have shed the blood of the children of Israel by the power of the sword at the time of their calamity, (Ps. 137:7; Dan. 9:24; Amos 1:11; Obad. 10) when their iniquity came to an end,

therefore, as I live,” says the Lord GOD, “I will prepare you for (Is. 63:1-6; Ezek. 16:38; 32:6) blood, and blood shall pursue you; (Ps. 109:17) since you have not hated blood, therefore blood shall pursue you.
Thus I will make Mount Seir most desolate, and cut off from it the (Judg. 5:6) one who leaves and the one who returns.
And I will fill its mountains with the slain; on your hills and in your valleys and in all your ravines those who are slain by the sword shall fall.
(Jer. 49:13; Ezek. 25:13) I will make you perpetually desolate, and your cities shall be uninhabited; (Ezek. 36:11) then you shall know that I am the LORD.

“Because you have said, ‘These two nations and these two countries shall be mine, and we will (Ps. 83:4-12; Ezek. 36:2, 5) possess them,’ although ((Ps. 48:1-3; 132:13, 14); Is. 12:6; Ezek. 48:35; Zeph. 3:15) the LORD was there,

therefore, as I live,” says the Lord GOD, “I will do ((Matt. 7:2; James 2:13)) according to your anger and according to the envy which you showed in your hatred against them; and I will make Myself known among them when I judge you.

(Ps. 9:16) Then you shall know that I am the LORD. I have (Zeph. 2:8) heard all your (Is. 52:5) blasphemies which you have spoken against the mountains of Israel, saying, ‘They are desolate; they are given to us to consume.’
Thus ((1 Sam. 2:3)) with your mouth you have boasted against Me and multiplied your (Ezek. 36:3) words against Me; I have heard them.”
‘Thus says the Lord GOD: (Is. 65:13, 14) “The whole earth will rejoice when I make you desolate.

(Obad. 12, 15) As you rejoiced because the inheritance of the house of Israel was desolate, (Jer. 50:11; Lam. 4:21) so I will do to you; you shall be desolate, O Mount Seir, as well as all of Edom—all of it! Then they shall know that I am the LORD.” ’
(Blessing on Israel) “And you, son of man, prophesy to the (Ezek. 6:2, 3) mountains of Israel, and say, ‘O mountains of Israel, hear the word of the LORD!

Thus says the Lord GOD: “Because (Jer. 33:24; Ezek. 25:3; 26:2) the enemy has said of you, ‘Aha! (Deut. 32:13; Ps. 78:69; Is. 58:14; Hab. 3:19) The ancient heights (Ezek. 35:10) have become our possession,’ ” ’

therefore prophesy, and say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Because they made you desolate and swallowed you up on every side, so that you became the possession of the rest of the nations, (Deut. 28:37; 1 Kin. 9:7; Lam. 2:15; Dan. 9:16) and you are taken up by the lips of (Ps. 44:13, 14; Jer. 18:16; Ezek. 35:13) talkers and slandered by the people”—

therefore, O mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord GOD! Thus says the Lord GOD to the mountains, the hills, the rivers, the valleys, the desolate wastes, and the cities that have been forsaken, which (Ezek. 34:8, 28) became plunder and (Ps. 79:4; Jer. 48:27) mockery to the rest of the nations all around—

therefore thus says the Lord GOD: (Deut. 4:24; Ezek. 38:19) “Surely I have spoken in My burning jealousy against the rest of the nations and against all Edom, (Ezek. 35:10, 12) who gave My land to themselves as a possession, with wholehearted joy and spiteful minds, in order to plunder its open country.” ’

“Therefore prophesy concerning the land of Israel, and say to the mountains, the hills, the rivers, and the valleys, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Behold, I have spoken in My jealousy and My fury, because you have (Ps. 74:10; 123:3, 4; Ezek. 34:29) borne the shame of the nations.”
Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “I have (Ezek. 20:5) raised My hand in an oath that surely the nations that are around you shall (Jer. 25:9, 15, 29) bear their own shame.
But you, O mountains of Israel, you shall shoot forth your branches and yield your fruit to My people Israel, for they are about to come.
For indeed I am for you, and I will turn to you, and you shall be tilled and sown.
I will multiply men upon you, all the house of Israel, all of it; and the cities shall be inhabited and (Is. 58:12; 61:4; Amos 9:14) the ruins rebuilt.

(Jer. 31:27; 33:12) I will multiply upon you man and beast; and they shall increase and bear young; I will make you inhabited as in former times, and do (Job 42:12; Is. 51:3) better for you than at your beginnings. (Ezek. 35:9; 37:6, 13) Then you shall know that I am the LORD.

Yes, I will cause men to walk on you, My people Israel; (Obad. 17) they shall take possession of you, and you shall be their inheritance; no more shall you (Jer. 15:7; Ezek. 22:12, 27) bereave them of children.”
‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Because they say to you, (Num. 13:32) ‘You devour men and bereave your nation of children,’
therefore you shall devour men no more, nor bereave your nation anymore,” says the Lord GOD.

(Is. 60:14; Ezek. 34:29) “Nor will I let you hear the taunts of the nations anymore, nor bear the reproach of the peoples anymore, nor shall you cause your nation to stumble anymore,” says the Lord GOD.’ ”
(The Renewal of Israel) Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying:

“Son of man, when the house of Israel dwelt in their own land, (Lev. 18:25, 27, 28; Jer. 2:7) they defiled it by their own ways and deeds; to Me their way was like (Lev. 15:19) the uncleanness of a woman in her customary impurity.
Therefore I poured out My fury on them (Ezek. 16:36, 38; 23:37) for the blood they had shed on the land, and for their idols with which they had defiled it.

So I (Deut. 28:64; Ezek. 5:12; 22:15; Amos 9:9) scattered them among the nations, and they were dispersed throughout the countries; I judged them (Ezek. 7:3; 18:30; 39:24; (Rom. 2:6)) according to their ways and their deeds.

When they came to the nations, wherever they went, they (Is. 52:5; Ezek. 12:16; Rom. 2:24) profaned My holy name—when they said of them, ‘These are the people of the LORD, and yet they have gone out of His land.’
But I had concern (Ezek. 20:9, 14) for My holy name, which the house of Israel had profaned among the nations wherever they went.

“Therefore say to the house of Israel, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “I do not do this for your sake, O house of Israel, (Ps. 106:8; Ezek. 20:44) but for My holy name’s sake, which you have profaned among the nations wherever you went.

And I will sanctify My great name, which has been profaned among the nations, which you have profaned in their midst; and the nations shall know that I am the LORD,” says the Lord GOD, “when I am (Is. 5:16; Ezek. 20:41; 28:22) hallowed in you before their eyes.
For (Is. 43:5, 6; Ezek. 34:13; 37:21) I will take you from among the nations, gather you out of all countries, and bring you into your own land.
